originalText.text: Even know this happened sometime ago will never forget they ruined an expensive vintage leopard pattern coat.. Shrank it so it could not fit.. said they would stretch it.. Ruined a coat worth 1000s.. never compensated.. never said sorry.. made up excuses..

originalText.text: We always love going here- the owners are so kind and friendly and they do a great job. They service the neighborhood well and you won’t be able to leave without a smile on your face! Deliver if you need and open early which is convenient

originalText.text: I was a little nervous going here after reading the very outdated reviews. But Grace was incredible! Grace worked on a very expensive and embellished pantsuit for my wedding and did a fabulous job. I highly recommend Grace. I will definitely be using this as my go to spot. Their prices are super reasonable too! Thank you Grace... you saved my big day!

Their prices are super reasonable too! Thank you Grace... you saved my big day!

originalText.text: Lost expensive item (pants) on first time we used their service.  Could not explain how item was lost and was not willing to reimburse value of lost item.  We waited patiently for a week for some kind of recourse.  They called us and said that they will not reimburse us and that we "wasted their time".  We will never use them again and will lodge a formal complaint with Better Business Bureau.  Beware.

originalText.text: I don't think it's worth the money. The prices are on the higher side for the Upper East. While I must admit, the service is great.. the problem is that I've needed service five times in the 5 months that I've been using them. I'm used to a place that picks up and drops off my dry cleaning, they have my credit card on file and they bill me. I don't expect much interaction with the cleaners. I've had two times when I received a shirt back and it was clearly not pressed. Completely wrinkled and i've had 3 times when I get my shirts back with cracked or chipped buttons. The issue is that when you call for service the person who picks up the phone speaks poor english, then she passes you to one of the managers. He does his best to offer free fixing but I don't want to keep calling. I tried to have a conversation and ask what they use that could be chipping the buttons but language was a barrier there too.
